text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Moslem-Croat Federation Prime Minister Edhem Bicakcic arrives in Strasbourg to attend plenary session of Council of Europe scheduled for Wednesday. In 1997, Bosnia is expected to become full member of Council of Europe.

- Moslem co-chairman of Bosnia's Council of Ministers Haris Silajdzic meets papal nunzio to Bosnia, Francesco Monterisi, to discuss planned visit by Pope John Paul to Sarajevo, Silajdzic's office reports.

- Recently established Bosnian government commissions charged with deliberating economic draft laws should conclude discussions by January 31, commission officials say at meeting with Council of Ministers. If laws are not adopted by end of month, Brussels donors conference on Bosnia scheduled for March 4 could be postponed until August.

- Bosnian Serb republic authorities are responsible for situation in north village of Gajevi and if they do not do what they are expected to do, they will bring on self-isolation, says Michael Steiner, deputy to International High Representative for Bosnia.
- Moslem chairman of collective Presidency Alija Izetbegovic receives award from U.S. Center for Democracy, Bosnian state TV correspondent in Washington D.C. reports.

- There is possibility that donors conference in Brussels will not take place at all. In that case 1.4 billion German marks would stay in account of European Union until Central Bosnian Bank and common currency for Bosnia are established, the daily quotes Brussels diplomatic sources as saying.

- Fifty Moslems and Croats were arrested by Bosnian Serb police after Dayton Peace Agreement was signed and are now in its prisons, head of Bosnian Commission for Missing Persons, Amor Masovic, says in interview.
- U.S. diplomat Robert Beecroft will probably become the new ambassador to Bosnia, a U.S. official who wants to be unnamed tells the daily. Former ambassador John Menzies left in December last year.
